name: **Freaghillaun Beg – _Fraochoileán Beag_**
description: Freaghillaun Beg – Fraochoileán Beag L825-227 Sheet 44 Granite ‘roches moutonées’, and boulders. Horses grazing. Very pleasant. Land easiest onto sand at sheltered E side between it and Crappagh, where beaches form to either side of the almost drying gap. Marked 51’ on half-inch OS map. In 2007 there was limited grazing which meant a beautiful profusion of wild flowers in August.
